greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of numbers whose largest prime power factor equals A000961(n).
comment: The largest prime power factor of a number n is given by A034699(n).
example: The first terms, alongside A000961(n) and the set of numbers k such that A034699(k) = A000961(n), are:
program: (PARI) my(l=1); for (k=1, 103, if (omega(k) <= 1, l = lcm(l, k); print1 (numdiv(l/k) ", ")))
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, May 27 2018
